docs.snippet: Several people were hurt on Friday in a flash fire at an oil refinery in southeast Texas, the local sheriff said.

headline.print_headline: Several People Injured in Flash Fire at Texas Oil Refinery
headline.main: Several People Injured in Flash Fire at Texas Oil Refinery

docs.snippet: He needs a jolt several times a day, and he gives it back to you. It’s a dangerous codependency.
An oversized rubber duck that was stolen from a New Hampshire family's home five years ago has returned, shrouded in a cloud of mystery and global intrigue.

headline.print_headline: Stolen Rubber Duck Returns After Odd Globe-Trotting Mystery
headline.main: Stolen Rubber Duck Returns After Odd Globe-Trotting Mystery

docs.snippet: The men were arrested on Tuesday, transferred to the country’s main counterterrorism center in Tunis, the capital, and then apparently handed over to American officials.

headline.print_headline: Tunisia Holds 2 From U.S. on Suspicion of Terror Ties
headline.main: Tunisia Briefly Holds Two From U.S. on Suspicion of Terror Ties

docs.abstract: Tunisian police officials report detention of American brothers Nathan and Patrick Lawwliss on suspicion of involvement with terrorist activities; men have since been released, reportedly driven away in United States Embassy car.

docs.snippet: Charges have been filed in the overdose death of Ted Nugent's property manager in southern Michigan.

docs.snippet: A small liberal arts college near Los Angeles is denouncing a Facebook post made by a black student who was seeking out a non-white roommate.

headline.print_headline: College Denounces Black Student's Non-White Roommate Request
headline.main: College Denounces Black Student's Non-White Roommate Request
